span.title: EHDS refined base model for This type is for containing or referencing attachments - additional data content defined in other formats. The most common use of this type is to include images or reports in some report format such as PDF. However, it can be used for any data that has a MIME type.

a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: Imaging report reflects the observations and interpretations of one or more imaging studies, contains elements such as the reason why the study is requested, relevant contextual medical information, the modality used to acquire images and its settings, procedures and body localisations that were used, a description of the observations and findings, exposure information, conclusion and advice.

short.value: Imaging report model

definition.value: Imaging report reflects the observations and interpretations of one or more imaging studies, contains elements such as the reason why the study is requested, relevant contextual medical information, the modality used to acquire images and its settings, procedures and body localisations that were used, a description of the observations and findings, exposure information, conclusion and advice.

short.value: Imaging Report header

definition.value: Common header for all patient-related data

short.value: Patient/subject information

definition.value: Patient/subject information

short.value: Unique identifier of the document

definition.value: Business identifier for the object

short.value: Report authoring details

definition.value: Resource authoring details

short.value: Author by whom the document was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.

definition.value: Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.

short.value: Date and time of authoring/issuing

definition.value: Date and time of authoring/issuing

short.value: Date and time of the last update to the resource (may be used for technical corrections).

definition.value: Date and time of the last update to the resource (may be used for technical corrections).

short.value: Status of the document

definition.value: Status of the resource or document

short.value: Reason for the current status of the resource.

definition.value: Reason for the current status of the resource.

short.value: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

definition.value: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

short.value: Type of document (code for medical imaging report)

definition.value: Type of document at hand, e.g. 60591-5 Patient summary document.

short.value: Human readable document title that can be displayed in search results, etc. This can be documentType's display name, or it can be assembled from multiple elements. Examples: 'Laboratory Result Report', 'Patient Summary of Jane Green 10.12.2024'

definition.value: Human readable document title that can be displayed in search results, etc. This can be documentType's display name, or it can be assembled from multiple elements. Examples: 'Laboratory Result Report', 'Patient Summary of Jane Green 10.12.2024'

short.value: Time of service that is being documented

definition.value: Time of service that is being documented

short.value: Business version of the document.

definition.value: Business version of the document.

short.value: Document attestation details

definition.value: Document attestation details

short.value: Attester who validated the document. Mulitple attesters could be provided.

definition.value: Attester who validated the document. Mulitple attesters could be provided.

short.value: Date and time of the approval of the document by Attester.

definition.value: Date and time of the approval of the document by Attester.

short.value: Document legal authentication details

definition.value: Document legal authentication details

short.value: The person taking responsibility for the medical content of the document

definition.value: The person taking responsibility for the medical content of the document

short.value: Date and time when the document was authorised.

definition.value: Date and time when the document was authorised.

short.value: Categorisation of the event covered by the document (e.g. laboratory study types, imaging study types including modality, etc.). Selection of such tags or labels depends on the use case and agreement between data sharing parties. This meta-data element serves primarily for searching and filtering purposes.

definition.value: Categorisation of the event covered by the document (e.g. laboratory study types, imaging study types including modality, etc.). Selection of such tags or labels depends on the use case and agreement between data sharing parties. This meta-data element serves primarily for searching and filtering purposes.

short.value: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)

definition.value: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)

short.value: Organisation that is in charge of maintaining the document/report.

definition.value: Organisation that is in charge of maintaining the document/report.

short.value: Level of confidentiality of the document. Implicit value is normal.

definition.value: Level of confidentiality of the document. Implicit value is normal.

short.value: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

definition.value: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

short.value: Accession number - an identifier, managed by the RIS at the local level, which usually uniquely identifies an imaging procedure request, and links it to imaging study(ies) and related imaging report(s). As it is prefixed by the registration authority it is a globally unique ID, usable both nationally and cross-border.

definition.value: Accession number - an identifier, managed by the RIS at the local level, which usually uniquely identifies an imaging procedure request, and links it to imaging study(ies) and related imaging report(s). As it is prefixed by the registration authority it is a globally unique ID, usable both nationally and cross-border.

short.value: Health insurance and payment information

definition.value: Health insurance and payment information

short.value: Information recipient (intended recipient or recipients of the report, additional recipients might be identified by the ordering party, e.g. GP, other specialist), if applicable

definition.value: Information recipient (intended recipient or recipients of the report, additional recipients might be identified by the ordering party, e.g. GP, other specialist), if applicable

short.value: Imaging Report structured body

definition.value: Imaging Report structured body

short.value: Order Information (Imaging Result Report could respond to multiple orders).

definition.value: Order Information (Imaging Result Report could respond to multiple orders).

short.value: Identifier(s) of the imaging service order.

definition.value: Identifier(s) of the imaging service order.

short.value: Date and time of the order placement.

definition.value: Date and time of the order placement.

short.value: The person/organisation "authorised" to place the order. Order placer could be either a health professional, health professional organisation or the patient himself.

definition.value: The person/organisation "authorised" to place the order. Order placer could be either a health professional, health professional organisation or the patient himself.

short.value: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in textual form.

definition.value: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in textual form.

short.value: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in coded or structured form.

definition.value: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in coded or structured form.

short.value: Specification of clinical question (goal of the investigation) to be answered by the imaging investigation.

definition.value: Specification of clinical question (goal of the investigation) to be answered by the imaging investigation.

short.value: Additional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may affect service delivery or interpretation.

definition.value: This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations. This includes observations explicitly requested by the producer (filler) to provide context or supporting information needed to complete the order. For example, reporting the metal implants present in patient's body.

short.value: Clinical findings and other observations (e.g., height and weights of the patient).

definition.value: Clinical findings and other observations (e.g., height and weights of the patient).

short.value: Conditions that may influence the service or result interpretation.

definition.value: Conditions that may influence the service or result interpretation.

short.value: Medication administered before ordering the service specifically for this procedure.

definition.value: Medication administered before ordering the service specifically for this procedure.

short.value: List of implants or devices that affect the course of the examination or its interpretation (e.g. metal implants).

definition.value: List of implants or devices that affect the course of the examination or its interpretation (e.g. metal implants).

short.value: Pregnancy status when the imaging examination was performed (e.g., pregnant, not pregnant, unknown).

definition.value: Pregnancy status when the imaging examination was performed (e.g., pregnant, not pregnant, unknown).

short.value: Sex parameter for clinical use - provides guidance on how a recipient should apply settings or reference ranges that are derived from observable information such as an organ inventory, recent hormone lab tests, genetic testing, menstrual status, obstetric history, etc. This property is intended for use in clinical decision making, and indicates that treatment or diagnostic tests should consider best practices associated with the relevant reference population.

definition.value: Sex parameter for clinical use - provides guidance on how a recipient should apply settings or reference ranges that are derived from observable information such as an organ inventory, recent hormone lab tests, genetic testing, menstrual status, obstetric history, etc. This property is intended for use in clinical decision making, and indicates that treatment or diagnostic tests should consider best practices associated with the relevant reference population.

short.value: Any other type of relevant supporting information

definition.value: Any other type of relevant supporting information

short.value: Specimen information. Note: A specimen (not attached to a body) can be used for diagnostic, forensic and medical research purposes.

definition.value: Specimen information. Note: A specimen (not attached to a body) can be used for diagnostic, forensic and medical research purposes.

short.value: Specification of requested service(s).

definition.value: Specification of requested service(s).

short.value: Information on total exposure to ionising radiation. This information is required by regulations in several EU countries.

definition.value: Information on total exposure to ionising radiation. This information is required by regulations in several EU countries.

requirements.value: eHN Guideline IMG (v1.1): B.1.4.4, Article 2 Imaging report definition

short.value: Effective dose - sum of equivalent doses to all organs, from external and/or internal exposures, each adjusted to account for the sensitivity of the organ to radiation. [mSv]

definition.value: Effective dose - sum of equivalent doses to all organs, from external and/or internal exposures, each adjusted to account for the sensitivity of the organ to radiation. [mSv]

short.value: Equivalent dose is based on the absorbed dose per organ, adjusted to account for the effectiveness of the type of radiation [mSv].

definition.value: Equivalent dose is based on the absorbed dose per organ, adjusted to account for the effectiveness of the type of radiation [mSv].

short.value: Equivalent dose is a measure of the radiation dose to tissue where an attempt has been made to allow for the different relative biological effects of different types of ionizing radiation. Equivalent dose is based on the absorbed dose per organ, adjusted to account for the effectiveness of the type of radiation [mSv].

definition.value: Equivalent dose is a measure of the radiation dose to tissue where an attempt has been made to allow for the different relative biological effects of different types of ionizing radiation. Equivalent dose is based on the absorbed dose per organ, adjusted to account for the effectiveness of the type of radiation [mSv].

short.value: Type of the tissue for which do dosage was enumerated.

definition.value: Type of the tissue for which do dosage was enumerated.

short.value: Examination report content.

definition.value: Examination report content.

short.value: Imaging modality (or modalities) used during imaging investigation (DICOM CID029).

definition.value: Imaging modality (or modalities) used during imaging investigation (DICOM CID029).

short.value: All body parts investigated

definition.value: All body parts investigated

short.value: Imaging procedure performed during imaging study.

definition.value: Imaging procedure performed during imaging study.

short.value: Adverse reactions manifested during imaging investigation.

definition.value: Adverse reactions manifested during imaging investigation.

definition.value: A concise and clinically contextualised summary including interpretation/impression of the diagnostic report.

short.value: Narrative description of the clinical conclusion (impression).

definition.value: Narrative description of the clinical conclusion (impression).

short.value: Condition or finding from imaging investigation.

definition.value: Condition or finding from imaging investigation.

short.value: A complex and structured information about recommended goals, activities and objectives in the form of one or more formal care plan.

definition.value: A complex and structured information about recommended goals, activities and objectives in the form of one or more formal care plan.

short.value: Documentation (reference) of a prior Imaging Report to which the current images were compared.

definition.value: Documentation (reference) of a prior Imaging Report to which the current images were compared.

short.value: Metadata of the DICOM study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context. A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.

definition.value: Metadata of the DICOM study. A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.
